original: Jönsson, Karl Edvard, chefredaktör, Karlskrona, f. 31/12/95 i Jämshögs s:n, Blek. 1., av Erik J. o. Selma Kastman. G. 1. 20 m. Gurli Lindén; 2. m. Thyra Malmgren, f. Östlund. Barn: Per-Erik f. 22, Nils Edvard 29. — Realex. i Karlshamn 13. Resa t. Engl. 23. Vol. i Engelholms-Bladet 13, platsred. i Älmhult f. Sölvesborgs-Tidn. 14, red. f. Sölvesborgs-Bladet 19, medarb. i Blek. L. Tidn. 20, i Sydsv. Dagbl. 24, andre red. i Blek. L. Tidn. 25, huv:-red. där .sed. 27. Sign.: E. J., -e, Nobody. Led. av stadsfullm. 38-42, pressekr. i Blek. turisttrafikfören., presskomm. v. jub :utställn. i Karlskrona 30, v. ordf. i lönend o. led. av skolstyr. Medl. av Sv. tidn :utg ifören., sekr. i dess .sydöstra krets, medl. av Publ:kl.
translated: Jönsson, Karl Edvard, editor-in-chief, from Karlskrona, born December 31st, 1895 in Jämshög parish, Blekinge county. Son of Erik J. and Selma Kastman. Married twice; first to Gurli Lindén in 1920, and second to Thyra Malmgren (born Östlund). Children: Per-Erik, born 1922, and Nils Edvard, born 1929. Completed secondary education in Karlshamn in 1913. Traveled to England in 1923. Worked at Engelholms-Bladet in 1913, became editor in Älmhult for Sölvesborgs-Tidningen in 1914, editor for Sölvesborgs-Bladet in 1919, collaborator for Blekinge Läns Tidning in 1920, for Sydsvenska Dagbladet in 1924, became assistant editor for Blekinge Läns Tidning in 1925, and became chief editor from 1927 and onwards. Used the pseudonyms E. J., -e, and Nobody. Was a member of the city council from 1938-1942, public relations officer for Blekinge Tourist Traffic Association, and press committee member for a jubilee exhibition in Karlskrona in 1930. Was also vice chairman and member of the school board. Membership in the Swedish Newspaper Publishers' Association and secretary of its southeastern region, as well as a member of the Publicist Club.

structured.name: Karl Edvard Jönsson
structured.description: Used the pseudonyms E. J., -e, and Nobody
